byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.
byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and NIKI KITSANTONIS

abstract: Greek Parliament and eurozone ministers approve international loan deal that will help Greek government avoid defaulting on upcoming debt payment; approval is won over course of all-night debate which revealed growing rebellion in Prime Min Alexis Tsipras party that may force him to call for vote of confidence for his government.
lead_paragraph: The plan was approved by lawmakers after a stormy parliamentary debate that began at 2 a.m. and lasted until 9:30 a.m. on Friday.

headline.main: As Greek Bailout Deal Passes, Alexis Tsipras Faces Rebellion
headline.print_headline: Bailout Package Passes Amid Dissent in Athens

snippet: The plan was approved by lawmakers after a stormy parliamentary debate that began at 2 a.m. and lasted until 9:30 a.m. on Friday.
